channel.title: Incredable Pain
channel.description:
Hey everyone, today when playing football with my friends at school, my head got landed on.. Very, very, very harshly.
Now, my head feels really heavy, and I'm dizzy and have a splitting head ache. It didn't worry me until about an hour ago, my had started feeling really bad... Every time I jerk it a little bit it cains the top of my head.
What should I do?

item.title: Incredable Pain
item.dc:creator: @mvp566 mvp566
item.description:
@mvp566 wrote:

If its still happening see a doctor…

Therealjdb said u already saw one

see one again!

Read full topic

item.title: Incredable Pain
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:35, topic:133471”]Well, the doctor said it was a post-concussion. He told me to rest for a while before doing anything again, and recommended I take at least 3 days off school.
And, to stay off any sports like that for max 2 weeks as it wasn’t a bad concussion.[/quote]
Shit, glad you know for sure what it was and I hope you feel better. <3

Read full topic

item.title: Incredable Pain
item.dc:creator: @o_town_reaper o_town_reaper
item.description:
@o_town_reaper wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:5, topic:133471”][quote author=therealjdb link=topic=184729.msg1673865#msg1673865 date=1187108980]
Maybe a concussion, is there any swelling and/or bumps on your head?
[/quote]
No, that’s what I’m trying to find now…
My neck feels really, weird… Like my head tilts really easily.
My visions a bit blurry too.[br][size=1]Posted on: August 14, 2007, 05:30:36[/quote]
Well the last time that happened to me I was high but I don’t think that is whats wrong with you so i just think its a concussion.

EDIT: fixed your quotes for you lol xD - jdb[br][size=1]Posted on: August 14, 2007, 09:16:31 PM[/size][hr]Thanks, I owe you bro.

Read full topic

Head injury’s are unpredictable, it may be worse tomorrow than it is now, I really fucking suggest you get your ass to the doctor asap.[/quote]

i agree, even if its concussion it is very dangerous.

item.title: Incredable Pain
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Yz85Racer:

Yeah. I don’t want to go to bed, as last time, the docter said to not let me fall asleep.

At LEAST

A) Turn down the brightness of your comp
B) Put a soft pillow behind you head
C) Put ice on your head and keep your neck still.

But, I’m going to bed. Going to sleep it off.

Bye.

item.title: Incredable Pain
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:21, topic:133471”][quote author=therealjdb link=topic=184729.msg1673948#msg1673948 date=1187111085]

* Changes in your ability to think, concentrate, or remember. - Done that alot.
* Headaches or blurry vision. - Alot.
* Changes in your sleep patterns, such as not being able to sleep or sleeping all the time. - Don't know, feel really tired though
* Changes in your personality such as becoming angry or anxious for no clear reason. - If at anything, I'm more melow.
* Lack of interest in your usual activities. - A bit.
* Changes in your sex drive. - Dunno :P
* Loss of your sense of taste or smell. - Nope.
* Feeling that you are spinning, whirling, falling, or tilting. - ALOT
*  Passing out. - Not yet.
* Not being able to remember what happened after the injury. - I can remember, vaguely.
* Acting confused, asking the same question over and over, slurring words, or not being able to concentrate. - I can't concentrate very well at the moment..
* Feeling lightheaded, seeing "stars," having blurry vision, or experiencing ringing in the ears. - Yes. Alot.
* Not being able to stand or walk; or having coordination and balance problems. - I'm fine with these, missing the keys alot though. I'm looking at m, and pressing g...
* Feeling nauseous or throwing up. - I feel nauseous.

Get off the computer and get some rest man, and if you don’t start feeling better goto a doctor.
[/quote]

Am i invisible?

Yea, so Yz, stfu and gtfo and into bed Mr.

Same thing i said, he wont listen. He is complaining and not even trying to help it.[/quote]
Either that or he just doesn’t want to get off the computer.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredable Pain
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

Symptoms of post-concussive syndrome include:

* Changes in your ability to think, concentrate, or remember.
* Headaches or blurry vision.
* Changes in your sleep patterns, such as not being able to sleep or sleeping all the time.
* Changes in your personality such as becoming angry or anxious for no clear reason.
* Lack of interest in your usual activities.
* Changes in your sex drive.
* Loss of your sense of taste or smell.
* Feeling that you are spinning, whirling, falling, or tilting.
*  Passing out.
* Not being able to remember what happened after the injury.
* Acting confused, asking the same question over and over, slurring words, or not being able to concentrate.
* Feeling lightheaded, seeing "stars," having blurry vision, or experiencing ringing in the ears.
* Not being able to stand or walk; or having coordination and balance problems.
* Feeling nauseous or throwing up.

Sound likes like what you’re describing to me.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredable Pain
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

You just got bumped, ure head is probably swelling in a few places to repair anything that was torn or broken a little bit. You may have concussion so just make sure you have someone near like a parent because there is a chance you will start throwing up. Other wise just wait a few days and your head will be back to normal.

Just rest, dont go do something stupid like sports. And other people have suggested ice… I think you should try this, the only thing it would do is keep pain away. So if it isnt benefitting you at all then there is no point in using ice.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredable Pain
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

therealjdb:

Sounds like a concussion to me, usually the only cure for that is bed rest and ice, however I am not a doctor and if you have the chance to I would recommend going to one if the problem continues.

I’ve had a concussion before - even a delayed one. But never as delayed if this is one. Max it was maybe an hour?
It’s been nearly, what, 10 hours now?

I’m starting to get a bit worried as I seem to be getting a bit dizzier by the minute, and the pain is growing.
I’m starting to get a bit worried if it might be a little bit of bleeding? Nah, wouldn’t be that bad.
I think if it’s still bad tomorrow I’ll go see the docter.[br][size=1]Posted on: August 14, 2007, 05:39:15 AM[/size][hr][quote=“exe626, post:12, topic:133471”]If you play football often, this should be nothing tbh. I get banged up alot, and I’m fine in a few hours. Getting your head knocked into the ground, and somebody landing on it, a nights rest should do it. Take a few Advil?[/quote]
I play football every day.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredable Pain
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Well, my main suggestion is ice, a soft pillow, a blanket, a couch, a tv, and hours alone. Or just go to bed, the constant stillness of your head wont affect you.

Read full topic
